Name.Raw: Bachelor of Science in Communicative Arts

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~   is experienced in the management of:  Marketing (Marketing Communications); and Sales.    ~~~~~~   has 21 years of work experience, with 4 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Current position is a mid-level management role: Marketing Director
Starting on 1/1/2019, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 21 months:
	Title: Marketing Director for The Multifamily Group
Starting on 1/1/2012, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 2 years:
	Title: Advertising Design Manager

Positions.Description:
Directed marketing efforts for multi-family real-estate brokerage.
• Created magazines and brochures for properties with images, property tours, financials and area
demographics that were sent to prospective buyers.
• Coordinated marketing projects and collaterals for 10 brokers.
• Developed marketing campaigns and communicated with senior management about marketing
initiatives to ensure projects where completed on time and within budget.
• Managed website using WordPress as well as Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, Google, YouTube.
• Marketed projects through email blasts via Constant Contact, social media, text platforms, regular mail and sending press releases to various media outlets.
• Created various custom promotional items, including notebooks, trophies, tumblers, pens and more, using
various outside vendors.

Produced and edited print advertisements for international client at full-service advertising agency.
• Designed new ads and performed modifications per client requests.
• Revised ads as required through proofing process, checking for missing elements, re-arranging copy blocks
and adding images and other elements as required.
• Advised manager on discrepancies in ad plans.
• Ensured copy legibility on all print materials.
• Demonstrated understanding of printing process to ensure all pages were built correctly.
• Proofed ads according to established proofing procedures, coordinating process with other departments.
• Provided additional creative client support on special projects.

Designed print advertisements for publisher of 14 weekly community newspapers.
• Worked with advertising sales representatives to gather materials for and design original eye-catching
display advertisements for broadsheet and tabloid pages.
• Produced up to 40 ads of different sizes each day during busy periods.
• Created spec ads for use by advertising sales representatives to help secure new business.
• Built classified advertising pages, managing complex protocols to ensure all ads were properly placed.
• Used creative techniques including typography and Photoshop manipulation to design effective ads, even
when given little direction or poor-quality images from clients.

Promoted to supervisor after less than a year at job; supervised staff of five designers until corporate
takeover resulted in elimination of separate ad design department.
• Managed staff performance, matching designers with specific projects based on skill level.
• Strengthened relationships between design staff and advertising sales staff by assigning designers to work
solely with specific ad representatives to build better communication and collaboration.
• Drafted and implemented procedures for better production flow.

Designed news and feature pages for Florida's second largest daily newspaper.
• Created eye-catching, readable layouts for inside pages and section covers.
• Designed up to a dozen pages each shift for the front, local news, sports and features sections of newspaper under tight deadlines, gathering art, managing story lengths and creating compelling visuals.
• Worked closely with photographers to produce high quality, attention-grabbing images.
• Collaborated with reporters and editors to accurately portray subject matter in a manner that attracted the attention of readers.
• Corrected color photographs to create best possible image reproduction on newsprint.
• Troubleshot computer problems for design team after integration of new newspaper design system.
• Served as main contact with multiple outside vendors regarding layouts and deadlines for comics, puzzle
pages and weekly TV book.
• Cross-trained with other team members to broaden skill set and effectively cover staff vacations and illnesses.

QualificationsSummary:
Computer Skills

•   Macintosh and PC		•   MS Office
•   Photoshop	•   Google Suite
•   Illustrator	•   Social Media Platforms
•   InDesign		•   WordPress
•   Acrobat		 •   Constant Contact

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every position in a resume should have an employer name.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'Computer Skills'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
~~~~~~  
Plano, Texas •    ~~~~~~~   •    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  


Graphic Designer
Efficient, resourceful professional with demonstrated success creating marketing campaigns for real estate
properties, designing all forms of digital and print materials including advertisements, newspaper pages, brochures,
catalogues, magazines and logos. Extremely organized with impeccable attention to detail. Manages both projects
and staff. Adapts quickly to new technology.
Direct Marketing • Promotions • Branding • Graphic Design • Conceptual Design • Social Media Marketing
Advertising • Organizational Skills • Client Collaboration • Typography • Bilingual English/Spanish

Career Experience

The Multifamily Group, Dallas, Texas	2019-2020
Marketing Director

• Created magazines and brochures for properties with images, property tours, financials and area
demographics that were sent to prospective buyers.

• Developed marketing campaigns and communicated with senior management about marketing
initiatives to ensure projects where completed on time and within budget.
• Managed website using WordPress as well as Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, Google, YouTube.
• Marketed projects through email blasts via Constant Contact, social media, text platforms, regular mail and
sending press releases to various media outlets.
• Created various custom promotional items, including notebooks, trophies, tumblers, pens and more, using
various outside vendors.

Ivie & Associates, Flower Mound, Texas	2015-2019

and adding images and other elements as required.
• Advised manager on discrepancies in ad plans.

Advertising Design Manager	2012-2013
• Promoted to supervisor after less than a year at job; supervised staff of five designers until corporate

• Managed staff performance, matching designers with specific projects based on skill level.
• Strengthened relationships between design staff and advertising sales staff by assigning designers to work
solely with specific ad representatives to build better communication and collaboration.
• Drafted and implemented procedures for better production flow.

The Miami Herald, Miami, Florida	2000-2011
Graphic Designer

• Designed up to a dozen pages each shift for the front, local news, sports and features sections of
newspaper under tight deadlines, gathering art, managing story lengths and creating compelling visuals.
• Worked closely with photographers to produce high quality, attention-grabbing images.

• Corrected color photographs to create best possible image reproduction on newsprint.
• Troubleshot computer problems for design team after integration of new newspaper design system.
• Served as main contact with multiple outside vendors regarding layouts and deadlines for comics, puzzle
pages and weekly TV book.
